newsitem.title: USA: Dow falls 50 points, NYSE sets curbs.
newsitem.headline: Dow falls 50 points, NYSE sets curbs.

text.p: U.S. blue chips widened their losses in late afternoon, triggering program trading curbs on the New York Stock Exchange.

The Dow fell 59 points to 7863, prompting the NYSE to impose index-arbitrage trading curbs at 1521 EDT/1921 GMT. The blue chip decline came as NYSE market breadth turned slightly negative for the first time in the session.
Tech stocks remained strong, adding to evidence that investors were looking beyond blue chips, analysts said.
"A lot of blue chip stocks are pretty overvalued and the techs generally are not, particularly the small caps" said Peggy Farley, chief executive at Amas Securities.
The Nasdaq Composite stood at 1517, up 14 points for the day.
